summary: Barry Harrelson was involved with the CIA's interactions with the Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB) regarding the release of JFK assassination records. He appears to have been a point of contact within the CIA for the ARRB, particularly concerning sensitive information such as CIA employees' names, overseas station details, and operational matters. He was involved in discussions about redaction policies, compliance with the JFK Assassination Records Collection Act, and the protection of classified information. Harrelson received briefing questions from Michelle Combs related to CIA's DS&T and DO, indicating his role in preparing for ARRB briefings. He also communicated with John Pereira regarding concerns about releasing CIA employees' names in JFK records.
significance: Barry Harrelson's significance lies in his role as a CIA liaison to the ARRB during the declassification and release of JFK assassination records. He was involved in navigating the complex issues of balancing transparency with the protection of classified information, CIA personnel, and ongoing operations. His work reflects the CIA's efforts to comply with the JFK Assassination Records Collection Act while safeguarding sensitive intelligence matters.
